title: Project-Based Learning to Strengthen Numeracy and Socioeconomic Concepts Through Digital Gaming

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced learning completion and high-level project execution experience, understanding of basic economic concepts (budgeting, resource allocation, citizen rights), interest in social problem-solving, and geographic/cultural context awareness.
context.additional_context: An environment enhancing motivation through personal device utilization and game elements. Scenario-based learning reflecting real social issues (e.g., urban planning, resource management, cultural facility placement). Provides context for enhancing learners' civic consciousness and institutional understanding.

learning_goals: Learners improve basic numeracy problem-solving skills (ratios, budget calculations, etc.) by over 40% within six months through digital game-based economic simulations and understand economic concepts related to social resource distribution and civic rights.

Learners apply three or more mathematical concepts (ratios, area, volume) to solve virtual city development budget management (5 million KRW budget) and spatial calculation (3D modeling tools) problems in PBL team projects (4â€“5 members), submit team deliverables (reports/prototypes), and achieve over 80% in four out of five rubric criteria (economic feasibility, creativity, collaboration, accuracy, completeness).
Learners establish and execute self-directed learning plans using in-game feedback systems, enhancing data analysis skills for social problem-solving and civic engagement competencies.

resources: Responsive Web-Based DGBL (Digital Game-Based Learning) Platform

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
